name: Travellers travelling in <Travel Class> class should earn <Bonus> bonus points

testSteps.description: 1: Travellers travelling in Economy class should earn 0 bonus points ({Travel Class=Economy, Points Earned=100, Bonus=0})

children.description: Given Tracy is a new Frequent Flyer Member

When she has completed the following flight
| From | To | Travel Class | Trip Date |
| Sydney | Hong Kong | Economy | 2021-03-01 |
Then her point balance should be 100 points

testSteps.description: 2: Travellers travelling in Premium Economy class should earn 50% bonus points ({Travel Class=Premium Economy, Points Earned=150, Bonus=50%})

children.description: Given Tracy is a new Frequent Flyer Member

When she has completed the following flight
| From | To | Travel Class | Trip Date |
| Sydney | Hong Kong | Premium Economy | 2021-03-01 |
Then her point balance should be 150 points

testSteps.description: 3: Travellers travelling in Business class should earn 100% bonus points ({Travel Class=Business, Points Earned=200, Bonus=100%})

children.description: Given Tracy is a new Frequent Flyer Member

When she has completed the following flight
| From | To | Travel Class | Trip Date |
| Sydney | Hong Kong | Business | 2021-03-01 |
Then her point balance should be 200 points

userStory.narrative:
Frequent Flyers earn status points each time they fly.
  As they earn more points, their status level increases and they get more benefits.

title: Travellers travelling in <Travel Class> class should earn <Bonus> bonus points
description: A flight from Sydney to Hong Kong normally earns 100 points

rule.name: Travellers earn more depending on the cabin class they fly in

dataTable.scenarioOutline:

When she has completed the following flight
